At the bottom you will see pre-made outlines. These outlines encompass either an image or a color. By default it encompasses a white color. You can change the outlines color by long pressing the desired outline. When you select an outline a preview will be displayed at the top of the page

At the bottom you can either select a background color or a background image. The images that will be shown are the images you have added to the application. In order to add images kindly navigate to the main page and click my images. At the bottom right there will be a button you can press. Once again when you click an image or select a color it will be displayed on the top view
At the bottom you will see text options. You can choose different fonts. You can change the color of the text and the size of the text. All clicks will be registered in the preview

At the top you will see your poem title. If you double tap areas on the poem view without text a drawer with buttons will appear from the bottom. You can long press them to see what they do. There are buttons to edit text size and alignment. There is a button that initiates a stanzas view. This page tries to emulate stanzas by allowing a user to add many different page views. The number of stanzas is shown at the bottom right of each page view To delete a stanza, long hold that stanza and it will delete the stanza. You can also save the current stanza as an image, pdf or a local application file. By default when you leave this page the application saves the current poem as a file

At the bottom right there is a button you can click to add images. The button will launch your image viewer and you can select the images you wish to add. If you have any poems that were saved as images you can view them by clicking "My Poems". You can only delete them through the page My Poems by deleting the entire file. If you click on any image or a poem thumbnail an image viewer will be opene

All your saved poems will be shown here. If you click them it will take you to the page to edit your poem. You can long press a poem thumbnail and share that poem outside the application as an image. You can delete a or many poems. You can only share a singular poem however. When you long click a thumbnail a bottom drawer will appear. If you choose to share your poem the saved images are automatically copied to the Downloads folder. The search button allows you to search for a poem. This is a simplified search. All found files will be display below the text entered. When you click on a search item The page to edit a poem will be opened.
Welcome to The Poets Kingdom. To get started you will be taken to the personalisation page where you shall edit a few things before first use.

Here you can edit a few things. The author name is your name and it will appear as the top text on a cover page for your poem. The cover page is the thumbnail that will be used to save poems. Your nickname is the name you would like to see in the home page of the application. It is limited to 30 characters. A poem can be in portrait or landscape mode. The landscape mode is noticeably smaller than the portrait. The landscape images are by default saved with resolution 1080 x 1080. They will not however look like this when editing the poem. The poem signature is a mark or a trademark added to the bottom of the cover page

This page serves the simple purpose of viewing images. In order to offer a unique experience the navigating through images, the buttons of a left and right arrow that are slightly visible are just guidelines. In actuality the starting 20% of your screen is clickable to go to the previous image. Subsequently the last 20% of your screen takes you to the next image.
